intro: Uncaria sessilifructus, commonly known as the sessile-fruited cat's claw, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that contain the seeds. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important component of its ecological community.
